verses.roman:
gopī-bhāva yāte prabhu dhariyāche ekānta
vrajendra-nandane māne āpanāra kānta

synonyms: gopī-bhāva—the mood of the gopīs; yāte—in which; prabhu—the Lord; dhariyāche—accepted; ekānta—positively; vrajendra-nandane—Lord Kṛṣṇa; māne—they accept; āpanāra—own; kānta—lover.
translation: Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu accepted the mood of the gopīs, who accept Vrajendranandana, Śrī Kṛṣṇa, as their lover.
